page.title: 01Mickleton Gloucestershire
page.content: The area is dominated on the North by{ {Meon Hill}with its Iron Age camp,and in the South by the{Cotswold edge} rising to Hidcote Bartrim and Lark Stoke.In the SW Mickleton is among {market gardening}holdings on sandy loams with{mixed farms}on the clays. Sheep are raised on the hills.{ {Buildings of note}are St Lawrence's Church,Manor House,Medford House,Tudor House,Kiftsgate Court,Admington Hall. In 1857 the school was built,in 1891 the Methodist Chapel.A vegetable brining plant was set up in the 1970's Buildings in the village are of red brick,Cotswold limestone,timber frame 'black and white',and reconstituted stone.Mickleton's population is c.1500 The Warks/Glos County Boundary bisects the area.
